desc: MDC1 is a regulator of the cell cycle response to DNA damage. It has tumor suppressor functions in the context of cancer.

Mediator of DNA damage check point protein 1 (MDC1) is a key regulator of the cell cycle in response to DNA damage (PMID: 12607005, 14519663). MDC1 binds to sites of DNA double-stranded breaks through its SDT domain, which binds to the MRN complex, and its BRCT domain which binds to phospho-H2AX (PMID: 16377563, 11741547, 16618811, 15201865). The main functions of MDC1 are to regulate the cell cycle check points in S and G2/M phase through Chk1/2 and to regulate TP53 apoptotic response to DNA damage (PMID: 12607005, 11100718, 12607004, 12607003, 16427009). MDC1 binds TP53 through its BRC1 domain which inhibits TP53 transactivation domain (PMID: 17535811, 24194938). Loss of MDC1 results in genomic instability and promotes oncogenesis in a variety of cancer entities (PMID: 17546051). In some cancers, however, oncogenic functions of MDC1 have been observed (PMID: 21853275).
